comments:
Had problems with M8, and now running I200404131323 .

The NPE is from the CVS console. I'm not sure that this is what caused the 
sync failure but I will fix it.

It turns out that the NPE was unrelated. I have been able to reproduce this. 
It turns out that after detaching the view, closing and then reopening it, 
sometimes the toolbar buttons do not work at all.
This is a UI bug. Stefan said he was fixing something similar

I am unable to reproduce this on a single head machine using I20040514.  Are you
still seeing it when dragging to the second monitor?  Michael, are you still
seeing it?

I don't work with detached views so I'm not a great yardstick for this but I 
am not able to reproduce with simple test scenarios.

This is not specific to the synch view. It happens with all detached views.

It seems to occur if the view was detached at the time it first opened (I can't
reproduce it if the view was first docked and then I dragged it out).

Flagging for RC1.

Not sure if eric was originally reporting the "all toolbars in detached views"
bug or not... but we seem to be tracking it here.

I'm able to reproduce this as follows:
1. Close all perspectives but the synch perspective
2. Detach the synch view
3. Restart Eclipse
4. Reattach the synch view

All toolbar buttons stop working.
This appears to be an SWT bug.
I've filed bug 65648 to report the problem with the Toolbar class.
